data.text:
The BMRCL is an initiative of the governments of Karnataka and India is Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited. Along with the duty of carrying out and managing the Bangalore Metro rail project, this special purpose project has been assigned. Metro Bengaluru is often referred to as Namma Metro.

BMRCL Recruitment 2024 Eligibility Criteria

To apply for BMRCL Recruitment 2024, you must meet a minimal set of requirements. Verify the age restriction and minimal educational requirements, as shown below.

The ITI, diploma, and BE/B. Tech from an accredited institution or institute is required of candidates. The age range (as of March 22, 2024) is 18 to 35.

Apply for BMRCL Recruitment 2024 Online

The direct link below will take you to the online application form for BMRCL Recruitment 2024, which is open to individuals interested in filling 236 positions. The deadlines for online applications and fee payments are April 24, 2024, and April 27, 2024, respectively.

The timetable for the BMRCL Recruitment 2024 exam and shift times for the 236 different positions that Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited is hiring for have been made public. The BMRCL Exam 2024 will take place in two shifts, morning and evening, on July 22, 23, and 30 of that year. The BMRCL Recruitment 2024 will accept online applications, and the exam dates are July 22, 23, and 30. Written exams and interviews are part of the selection process. Salary ranges from Rs. 25000 to Rs. 94500.

BMRCL Recruitment 2024 Application Fee

To submit their BMRCL Application Form 2024 for BMRCL Recruitment 2024, applicants must pay the requisite application cost. The costs must be paid online using an online payment method.

Applicants for general, 2A, 2B, 3A, and 3B shall pay 1180 Rupees plus 18% GST

SC/ST classification must pay: 590 Rupees plus 18% GST

How to Apply for the BMRCL Recruitment 2024

Go to access Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited’s (BMRCL) official website.

Visit the website for careers.

Find the text “BMRCL/O&M/C-32065/R-02/2024 & Notification No.BMRCL/O&M/C-32065/R-01/2024” by searching for it.

To access the BMRCL Application Form 2024, click the apply online link.

Please make sure the information is correct.

After giving their online application a preview, upload the form together with the necessary files.

BMRCL Recruitment 2024 for GATE

Using their GATE 2024 Score, candidates may apply online for Graduate Engineer positions at Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL). For the BMRCL Recruitment 2024, candidates who meet the requirements and hold a degree in one of the following fields: civil, mechanical, electrical, electronics, or instrumentation. Candidates are hired by BMRCL based on their GATE score for a variety of roles, including junior engineers, section engineers, assistant engineers, etc.

For various roles, there are varying qualifying requirements for BMRCL recruitment 2024 using GATE. As stated in the official announcement, aspirants must, however, possess a valid GATE score and have fulfilled the necessary educational requirements.

Salary: INR 25,000/-

Graduate engineers must have scored at least 60% in the appropriate subject and 60% in the GATE 2024 exam.

Age Limit for BMRCL

Candidates interested in BMRCL recruitment 2024 must meet the following age requirements as of 31st July 2024, in addition to the other requirements.

Post

UR, 35 years OBC, 38 years ST/SC, 38 years.

Knowledge of the Kannada Language

If you are interested in the position, you must be fluent in Kannada in all four domains: reading, speaking, writing, and comprehending. The level of Kannada proficiency will be assessed throughout the document verification process. Regardless matter how well a candidate does on the GATE, those who do not speak Kannada will be dismissed.

BMRCL Admit Card 2024

On July 14, 2024, Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) made available the BMRCL Admit Card 2024 for BMRCL Recruitment 2024 via its official website. 236 posts for Station Controller/Train Operator, Section Engineer, and Maintainer will be filled through the BMRCL Exam in 2024.

Those who apply for these positions may go visit the official website or use the direct link provided to get their BMRCL Hall Ticket 2024. Applicants must log in using the application information they submitted, including their name, application number, and the department to which it was sent.

How to Download BMRCL Admit Card PDF

The procedures listed below can be used by candidates to download the BMRCL Admit Card PDF for BMRCL Recruitment 2024.

Visit www.bmrc.co.in, the BMRCL’s official website.

Fill in your birthdate and application number

The BMRCL Admit Card PDF is about to show up on the screen.

Download it, then bring a hard copy to the exam location.

BMRCL Maintainer Recruitment 2024

Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited has released the BMRCL Maintainer Recruitment Notification 2024.

There are 29 openings for Station Controller/Train Operator and Maintainer (Local Cadre) and 207 openings for Station Controller/Train Operator, Section Engineer, and Maintainer (Residual Cadre). There are 236 positions open in total.

Educational Qualification

Candidates must hold an ITI, Diploma, BE, or B.Tech from an accredited college or university.

Conclusion

For those who have a strong desire to make a positive impact in the field of urban transportation, BMRCL’s Recruitment 2024 offers an incredible opportunity. Prospective applicants are urged to take advantage of this opportunity, carefully consider the qualifying requirements, and set out on a path to join the committed team at BMRCL. Accept the opportunities, and let’s work together to influence Bangalore’s metro train services in the future.

FAQ

Q1. When did Bangalore Metro open?

BMRC/Started operating on October 20, 2011. When operations began, the people responded in overwhelming numbers. 169,019 passengers rode the metro in the first three days of operation, according to BMRCL sources.

Q2. How does Bengaluru Metro work?

The trains receive their electricity from the third rail, which delivers 750 volts of direct current. The trains travel at a speed of slightly less than 80 km/h and operate every 5 to 15 minutes. Trains on the systems run beneath, above, and on the ground. They consist of six carriages.

Q3. Who owns Bangalore Metro?

Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL), a special purpose entity jointly owned by the State Government of Karnataka and the Government of India, was founded in 2005 and is responsible for building and running the Bengaluru Metro.

Q4. How many metros are there in Bangalore?

Two metro lines are currently in service: Purple and Green. Nearly the whole city is connected by the metro line. For the areas that are not linked, the metro connection is being built, or a metro line is being considered. Every month, Bangalore Metro transports between 2.5 and 3.5 lakh passengers.
